prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Guide to Virginia Architectural Drawings, Accession 5946-g, Special Collections Department, University of Virginia Library

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The drawings were given to the Library by James A. Cox through K. Edward Lay, both of the School of Architecture, Campbell Hall, the University of Virginia, on August 3, 1990.

processinfo.head: Funding Note
processinfo.p: Funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of measured architectural drawings, 1970-1971, and undated, 149 items, of seventeen historic Virginia buildings. These drawings were produced for the Historic American Building Survey(HABS) by architectural students of the University of Virginiaunder the direction of Professor James A. Coxof the School of Architecture. The buildings represented are from Northampton County, Essex County, Rockbridge County, Accomack County, Augusta County, Lexington, Strasburg, and Richmond.

did.unittitle: Alexander-Withrow House, Lexington, Virginia, drawn by Arthur Crook, Daniel Donovan& Gregory Lukmire, 1 complete set (6 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (5 sheets)
Glebe House, Tappahannock, Essex County, Virginia, drawn by David Bell, George Candler, & William Daggett, Jr., 1 complete set (6 sheets)
Harmony Hall, Strasburg, Virginia, drawn by Arthur Crook, Daniel Donovan & Gregory Lukmire, 1 complete set (7 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (4 sheets)
Log Cabin, Winterview Farm, Rockbridge County, Virginia, drawn by Bruce MacDougal, 1 incomplete set (2 sheets)
Mason House, Guilford, Accomack County, Virginia, drawn by David Bell, George Candler, & William Daggett, Jr., 1 complete set (7 sheets)
Pear Valley, Star Route 628, Northampton County, Virginia, drawn by Daniel Donovan, Charles King, & Bruce MacDougal, 1 complete set (5 sheets), and 1 incomplete set (2 sheets)
Reid-White House, Lexington, Virginia, drawn by Arthur Crook, Daniel Donovan, & Gregory Lukmire, 1 complete set (8 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (6 sheets)
Ritchie House, Tappahannock, Essex County, Virginia, drawn by David Bell, George Candler, & William Daggett, Jr., 1 complete set (6 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (1 sheet)
Rockfish Service Station, Augusta County, Virginia, drawn by Arthur Crook, Daniel Donovan, & Gregory Lukmire, 1 complete set (6 sheets)
Somers' House, Jamesville, Northampton County, Virginia, drawn by David Bell, George Candler, & William Daggett, Jr., 1 complete set (14 sheets)
Stono, Lexington, Virginia, drawn by Arthur Crook, Daniel Donovan, & Gregory Lukmire, 1 incomplete set (10 sheets)
Thorn Hill, Lexington, Virginia, drawn by Benjamin Dyer& James Patrick Graham, 2 complete sets (11 sheets each)
Tucker Cottage, Richmond, Virginia, drawn by George Candler & William Daggett, 2 complete sets (2 sheets each)
Wessel's Root Cellar, Hallwood, Accomack County, Virginia, drawn by David Bell & William Daggett, Jr., 1 complete set (3 sheets)
Westerhouse, Church Neck, Northampton County, Virginia, drawn by Bruce MacDougal, Charles King, & Daniel Donovan, 1 complete set (3 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (1 sheet)
Westover, Old Town Neck, Northampton County, Virginia, drawn by Bruce MacDougal, Daniel Donovan, & Charles King, 1 complete set (7 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (3 sheets)
Winona, Church Neck, Northampton County, Virginia, drawn by Bruce MacDougal, Charles King, & Daniel Donovan, 1 complete set (8 sheets) and 1 incomplete set (3 sheets)
